Turkish.title: Turkish Baklava
Turkish.instructions: Mix nuts with sugar and spices. Layer phyllo sheets with melted butter and nut mixture. Cut into diamonds. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Make syrup with sugar, water, honey, cinnamon, and lemon juice. Pour hot syrup over cooled baklava. Let sit for 4 hours before serving.

Turkish.title: Kebab
Turkish.instructions: Marinate lamb with onion, garlic, oil, lemon juice, and seasonings for 2 hours. Thread onto skewers. Grill over medium heat, turning frequently, until cooked through. Serve with pita bread and tzatziki sauce.

Turkish.title: Turkish Delight
Turkish.instructions: Boil sugar, water, and lemon juice until sugar dissolves. Mix cornstarch with water and add to sugar mixture. Cook, stirring constantly, until thick. Add rose water and food coloring. Pour into greased pan and let cool. Cut into squares and dust with powdered sugar.

Turkish.title: Manti
Turkish.instructions: Make dough with flour, water, egg, and salt. Let rest for 30 minutes. Mix filling ingredients. Roll dough thin and cut into squares. Add filling and seal. Boil until cooked. Mix yogurt with garlic and mint. Heat butter with paprika. Serve manti with yogurt sauce and paprika butter.

Turkish.title: Turkish Tea
Turkish.instructions: Boil water in bottom pot of Turkish tea set. Add tea leaves to top pot. Pour boiling water over tea leaves. Let steep for 5 minutes. Serve in Turkish tea glasses with sugar cubes.

Persian.title: Persian Rice
Persian.instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Boil rice with salt until half cooked. Drain and rinse. Mix saffron with warm water. Mix yogurt with eggs and water. Heat butter and oil in pot. Add yogurt mixture and half the rice. Add remaining rice and saffron. Cover and cook on low heat for 45 minutes. Serve with tahdig (crispy bottom).

Persian.title: Kebab Koobideh
Persian.instructions: Mix ground lamb with onion, garlic, oil, lemon juice, and seasonings. Form into long, thin patties around skewers. Grill over medium heat, turning frequently, until cooked through. Serve with basmati rice and grilled tomatoes.

Persian.title: Ghormeh Sabzi
ingredients: 2 cups fresh herbs (parsley, cilantro, fenugreek, leeks)
Persian.instructions: Brown lamb in oil. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Add herbs and cook for 10 minutes. Add dried limes, beans, and seasonings. Add water and simmer for 2 hours until tender. Serve with basmati rice.

Persian.title: Tahdig
Persian.instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Boil rice with salt until half cooked. Drain and rinse. Mix saffron with warm water. Mix yogurt with eggs and water. Heat butter and oil in pot. Add yogurt mixture and half the rice. Add remaining rice and saffron. Cover and cook on low heat for 45 minutes. Serve with tahdig (crispy bottom).

Persian.title: Persian Ice Cream
Persian.instructions: Heat cream and milk with half the sugar. Beat egg yolks with remaining sugar. Temper egg yolks with hot cream mixture. Cook until thickened. Add vanilla and rose water. Chill completely. Churn in ice cream maker. Add nuts and freeze until firm.

Lebanese.title: Lebanese Baklava
Lebanese.instructions: Mix nuts with sugar and spices. Layer phyllo sheets with melted butter and nut mixture. Cut into diamonds. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Make syrup with sugar, water, honey, cinnamon, and lemon juice. Pour hot syrup over cooled baklava. Let sit for 4 hours before serving.

Lebanese.title: Hummus
Lebanese.instructions: Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, oil, salt, and cumin until smooth. Add water if needed for consistency. Garnish with paprika and parsley. Serve with pita bread.

Lebanese.title: Fattoush
ingredients: 2 pita breads, toasted and broken into pieces
Lebanese.instructions: Combine all vegetables and herbs in large bowl. Add pita pieces. Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve immediately.

Lebanese.title: Kibbeh
Lebanese.instructions: Soak bulgur for 30 minutes. Mix with ground lamb, onion, and seasonings. Knead until smooth. For filling, brown ground lamb with onion and garlic. Add pine nuts and seasonings. Form bulgur mixture into shells. Add filling and seal. Fry in hot oil until golden.

Lebanese.title: Tabbouleh
Lebanese.instructions: Soak bulgur in warm water for 30 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water. Combine with vegetables and herbs. Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve immediately.

Moroccan.title: Tagine
Moroccan.instructions: Brown lamb in oil. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Add tomatoes, dried fruits, nuts, and seasonings. Add water and simmer for 2 hours until tender. Serve with couscous.

Moroccan.title: Couscous
Moroccan.instructions: Heat stock with oil and seasonings. Pour over couscous and let sit for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Add raisins and almonds. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Moroccan.title: Harira
Moroccan.instructions: Brown lamb in oil. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Add tomatoes, chickpeas, lentils, rice, and seasonings. Add water and simmer for 1 hour until tender. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Moroccan.title: Pastilla
Moroccan.instructions: Sauté onions and garlic in oil. Add chicken, almonds, raisins, and seasonings. Cook for 10 minutes. Layer phyllo sheets with chicken mixture. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

Moroccan.title: Mint Tea
Moroccan.instructions: Boil water and add tea leaves. Let steep for 2 minutes. Add mint leaves and sugar. Let steep for 3 minutes. Strain and serve in Moroccan tea glasses.

Moroccan.title: Quick Turkish Delight
Moroccan.instructions: Heat sugar and water until dissolved. Mix cornstarch with rose water. Add to sugar mixture and cook until thick. Add pistachios. Pour into pan and cool. Cut into squares and dust with powdered sugar.

Moroccan.title: Quick Turkish Tea
Moroccan.instructions: Boil water in teapot. Add tea leaves and steep for 3 minutes. Add sugar to taste. Serve in traditional Turkish tea glasses.

Moroccan.title: Quick Persian Rice
Moroccan.instructions: Wash and soak rice for 10 minutes. Boil rice until 70% done. Drain. Heat butter and add saffron. Layer rice in pot. Add barberries. Cover and cook on low for 15 minutes. Serve with crispy bottom layer.

Moroccan.title: Quick Lebanese Tabbouleh
Moroccan.instructions: Soak bulgur in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain and cool. Mix with tomatoes, cucumber, parsley, and mint. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. Toss with salad. Chill for 10 minutes before serving.

Moroccan.title: Quick Moroccan Tagine
Moroccan.instructions: Brown chicken with onion and garlic. Add spices and cook for 1 minute. Add chickpeas, apricots, and broth. Simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is cooked. Season with salt and pepper.

Moroccan.title: Quick Egyptian Ful Medames
Moroccan.instructions: Mash fava beans with garlic. Add olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Serve with pita bread.

Moroccan.title: Quick Israeli Shakshuka
Moroccan.instructions: Heat oil and cook onion and bell pepper until soft. Add garlic and spices. Add tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes. Make wells and crack eggs into them. Cover and cook for 5 minutes until eggs are set. Garnish with herbs.

Moroccan.title: Quick Ethiopian Injera
Moroccan.instructions: Mix teff flour with water and salt. Let ferment for 2 hours. Add baking powder. Heat oil in pan. Pour batter and cook until bubbles form. Flip and cook other side. Serve with stews.

Moroccan.title: Quick South African Bobotie
Moroccan.instructions: Cook beef with onion and garlic until browned. Add apple, raisins, and spices. Season with salt and pepper. Place in baking dish. Beat eggs with milk and pour over meat. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes until set.

Moroccan.title: Quick Nigerian Jollof Rice
Moroccan.instructions: Heat oil and cook onion until soft. Add garlic, bell pepper, and spices. Add tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add rice and broth. Bring to boil, then simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Moroccan.title: Quick Turkish Kebab
Moroccan.instructions: Marinate lamb with onion, garlic, oil, and spices for 30 minutes. Thread onto skewers. Grill for 8 minutes, turning occasionally. Serve with pita bread.

Moroccan.title: Quick Persian Kebab
Moroccan.instructions: Mix lamb with onion, garlic, and spices. Form into patties. Grill for 6 minutes per side. Serve with basmati rice.

Moroccan.title: Quick Lebanese Hummus
Moroccan.instructions: Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, oil, cumin, and salt until smooth. Serve with pita bread.

Moroccan.title: Quick Moroccan Couscous
Moroccan.instructions: Heat broth with oil and spices. Pour over couscous and let sit for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Add raisins and almonds. Season with salt.

Moroccan.title: Quick Egyptian Koshari
Moroccan.instructions: Cook rice, lentils, and macaroni separately. Fry onion until crispy. Cook garlic with tomato sauce and cumin. Combine all ingredients. Season with salt and pepper.

Moroccan.title: Quick Israeli Falafel
Moroccan.instructions: Blend chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, and spices. Add flour. Form into balls. Fry until golden. Serve in pita bread.

Moroccan.title: Quick Ethiopian Doro Wat
Moroccan.instructions: Cook chicken until browned. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes. Add berbere, tomatoes, and broth. Simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Moroccan.title: Quick South African Biltong
Moroccan.instructions: Marinate beef with vinegar, salt, coriander, pepper, and sugar for 2 hours. Dry in oven at 150°F for 4 hours. Slice and serve.

Moroccan.title: Quick Kenyan Ugali
Moroccan.instructions: Bring water to boil. Add salt and cornmeal gradually. Stir constantly until thick. Add butter. Serve with stews.

Moroccan.title: Quick Ghanaian Banku
Moroccan.instructions: Mix cornmeal and cassava flour. Bring water to boil. Add flour mixture gradually. Stir until thick. Serve with fish stew.

Moroccan.title: Quick Senegalese Thieboudienne
Moroccan.instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper. Cook until done. Sauté onion and garlic. Add tomatoes and spices. Add rice and broth. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with fish.

Moroccan.title: Quick Tunisian Couscous
Moroccan.instructions: Heat broth with oil, harissa, and cumin. Pour over couscous and let sit for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Add chickpeas. Season with salt.

Moroccan.title: Quick Algerian Chakchouka
Moroccan.instructions: Heat oil and cook onion and bell pepper until soft. Add garlic and spices. Add tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes. Make wells and crack eggs. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.

Moroccan.title: Quick Libyan Bazeen
Moroccan.instructions: Bring water to boil. Add salt and barley flour gradually. Stir until thick. Add oil. Serve with meat stew.

Moroccan.title: Quick Sudanese Ful Medames
Moroccan.instructions: Mash fava beans with garlic. Add oil, lemon juice, cumin, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Serve with bread.
